meanings.definition: Boastful or inflated talk or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His rodomontade about his achievements was tiresome to listen to.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his constant rodomontade about his wealth.
meanings.sent3: The rodomontade of the little squirrel claiming to have climbed the tallest tree was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The rodomontade of the storm, boasting about its power, was followed by a gentle rain.
meanings.sent5: The rodomontade of the lion, declaring itself the king of the jungle, echoed through the savannah.

meanings.sent1: Her rodomontade about her cooking skills was met with skepticism by her friends.
meanings.sent2: The politician's rodomontade during the debate failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent3: The rodomontade of the cat, claiming to catch the biggest mice, made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The rodomontade of the wind, howling through the night, kept the children awake.
meanings.sent5: The rodomontade of the peacock, showing off its colorful feathers, attracted many admirers.

meanings.sent1: He was known in the village as a rodomontade who always exaggerated his hunting stories.
meanings.sent2: The office was filled with the rodomontade of the new employee, bragging about his previous successes.
meanings.sent3: The rodomontade of the parrot, claiming to speak ten languages, amused the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The rodomontade of the sun, boasting its brightness, warmed the earth.
meanings.sent5: The rodomontade of the river, bragging about its length, flowed steadily towards the sea.
